website_summaries.verdict: An excellent price for an excellent boot – the Kamik is the best choice for anyone on a tight budget.
pros: Waterproof boot that has a removable insole for extra support
cons: Some reports that boots are narrow in calf and ankle

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Like them! Very comfy!!!! As a reference I am 5,1 and 107 lbs, I usually wear size 6 but ordered 7 and they fit good, enough space for socks....probably a 6 will fit good too but I rather go for the secure option. I am attaching pictures so you can see the color and how tall they are. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: David Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great for rainy Seattle days.
customer_reviews.text: I love Hunter boots, but I have a hard time justifying the Indonesian rubber that goes into their boots. Did you know endangered orangutans are shot and killed for getting into rubber tree plantations? So, I decided to seek out a more eco-friendly alternative to these trendy status symbols. I am so glad I did! I normally wear a 8.5 or 9 shoe and these, in a size 9, fit perfectly! Dare I say that they fit better than their more expensive competitors? Yes!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Mays

customer_reviews.title: Snug and narrow at the ankles and around the feet, but nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are snug boots, narrow around the ankles and feet. I typically wear a women's size 7.5 regular width, and I ordered a size 8 in these. They just barely fit my feet with just a touch of room at the toe. I would suggest ordering a full size up from what you normally wear. If you have wide feet, bunions, or ankles that aren't slim, these may not work for you. That said, for me, average size body and bone structure (5'6" and 125 lbs), they work fine. But I did order up half a size, and I'm glad I did. They seem to run a bit small, and definitely narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Kamik boots are great! If you have thinner calves/ankles, this is a great rain/gardening boot.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I use the. For everything, going out in the rain, taking the dog to the bathroom, and even gardening outside. The quality is exceptional, but they do run a little tight. I have thin calves, so this isn’t a problem for me, but people with larger ankles and calves may have trouble with this particular style since it can be a little tight even for me getting the boot on/off. It would be worth finding another style that works better from this company. Bonus: When they do finally wear out, which I imagine will be quite a long while, the company will take them back and recycle them for you!
customer_reviews.author: J.Li

customer_reviews.title: I'm size 8.5, ordered the 10. Nice, very pretty boots
customer_reviews.text: I am 8.5 in shoes, sometimes 9 because I like some space, not tight shoes...with these rain boots I order size up 10 and they are ok for me, not tight, it means I have some space to move my toes and wear jeans if I want to. They feel comfortable with socks, leggings, shorts and they look beautiful and fashionable too. Actually the blue ones I have, make me feel like it is a beautiful day outside, instead of the traditional gray rainy day it was made for.... soo I want to wear them even without any rain!! No issues no problems walking with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana MdA

customer_reviews.title: love but definitely run small
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a 7 and I had to return my 7.5s and go with 8s, they definitely run smaller and it's not because of the size of the shoe part itself, it's because the part where the shaft starts is not wide enough so the foot can't make the turn. They are not as heavy as Hunter boots, but they're still rubber boots and therefore slightly heavy. I have plantar fasciitis so I have to always wear an insole and these, in the bigger size, allow me to wear them (but I could barely get my foot in there even without them in the smaller size).
customer_reviews.author: Vlarr

customer_reviews.title: Warm, dry and very comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear 8.5 in all shoes, but I did go up 1/2 size per the advice from the reviews. I love these boots! Why pay $125 for other name brand boots when you can wear these stylish, comfortable and warm rain boots? I wore them over 12 hours in a college tailgate swamp.... Literally, it had rained for days and days.... Walking in cold water did not affect the warmth or dryness of my feet. I LOVE these boots! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: These are very waterproof, and they look great, but they are so hard for me to walk in, and they’ve given me insane blisters when trying to walk even just half a mile. Also, BELIEVE the reviewers talking about calf width as an issue. I’m a fairly small person, and I have small feet (5.5 women’s) so I figured I’d be fine. They are so tight. Measure your calves before you buy, and definitely don’t wear without long socks (to avoid blisters). I added inserts to keep my feet in place better, and that helped, but I just can’t help avoiding them at this point. Just don’t work for my body I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Boot cut is very narrow at ankles!
customer_reviews.text: This pair of boots was purchased for my daughter at college. She is a tall thin woman with a size 8.5 shoe. I usually purchase her size 9 boots. I did in this case as well. The cut around the ankle was so tight that they were uncomfortable with socks. She could not walk and bend her ankle easily. I returned them and purchased a Totes brand size 9 rain boot that fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn Wander

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the navy blue and pink. They are very cute and super comfortable with good support. I have a narrow foot and they fit great, might be a little snug if you have a wide foot and wear them with thick socks. True to size, I wear a 7 and ordered a 7. They fit great around my calf, I do NOT have a wide calf and most rain boots stick out too far, these do not. There’s just enough room That I can wear with high thick socks during colder months. No manufacture defects and they look and feel very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Cuocco

customer_reviews.title: Cute, waterproof and slim fitting
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so cute and work so well. They're sturdy and surprisingly heavy, but also completely waterproof. I agree the top is tight and if you have any kind of calf muscle they won't work. I like how tight they are because they look good with leggings and skinny jeans, and there isn't much room for water to leak in as you walk in the rain. I've worn them a lot and they're surprisingly comfortable! I have bunions and huge feet and these really are cozy, good for walking long distances, and look great. I've gotten tons of compliments - who'd expect that with rain boots!
customer_reviews.author: Hilarony

customer_reviews.title: Best rain boot
customer_reviews.text: I am an LAUSD teacher!! We have been on strike for the last 5 days. For the first 4 days it rained every day. I bought these boots knowing that it was supposed to rain Monday-Thursday. These boots were incredible!! I walked all day in them for 4 days and my feet stayed dry every day!!! They were comfortable and easy to take on and off. I have very narrow feet and small calves so they were a perfect fit for me!!! I also bought some boot socks which I wore for extra warmth and comfort. I highly recommend these!!! Great book for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the rainboots they get the job done when it is raining. My only issue it is hard to drive with them on. They are pretty tight near the toe area. The boots are pretty stiff I am not sure if this will get better once they are broken in. You do have to wear pretty thick socks because the boots are not insulated so my toes tend to get a little cold if I am not wearing the right socks. Overall they are decent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Size up for the perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I took other reviewers advice and sized up from my normal size 8 1/2 to a nine. I have high arches so I figured I better. These boots are really nice, made in Canada....great surprise....and made of rubber, not a synthetic! I had a pair of Hunter boots in the past that lasted me twenty-five years but this time I didn't want to spend such a huge price for something I wear to keep my feet dry. These seem well made, waterproof and actually look quite stylish as I slog about my gardens. I had never heard of this company but I'm glad I took a chance and ordered these Olivia boots, I like them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne T

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, but difficult to put on and remove
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, they were a great investment for me, as a college student who has to walk across an entire campus on rainy days. The only thing that I had an issue with, and was not so significant that I would take a star off my review, is that they’re incredibly difficult to put on and take off. I don’t know if this is the norm for rubber rain boots, but it doesn’t subtract from how effective they are at their job. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Too small by far
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a size 7 so I sized her up an entire size after reading reviews to an 8 ... still way too small. In fact, we compared this size 8 boot to her size 6 rain boot and it was exactly the same length! I do like the heavier-duty Kamik material, but that does also make it more weighty and getting boots on more difficult. We are returning and buying a different boot entirely.
customer_reviews.author: marvelgrrl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for slim legs
customer_reviews.text: These boots are perfect for me because I have slim legs. A person with fuller legs will not be able to wear these. These are the most comfortable boots ever! When buying I was confused by all the comments that said to size up a whole size. Now I know that they said this because of the narrow opening of the boot. I normally wear a & in boots and the & in this boot fit just right. No wiggle room but perfect. If they were a bit less expensive I would get another pair :) Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Treemg

customer_reviews.title: Will cut off circulation in your calves 😂
customer_reviews.text: As majority of review stated, I ordered a size up in the boots. I don’t think that was nessessary, as the boots were too big in the foot portion of the shoe (my normal size probably would have worked). BUT, the calf portion was VERY tight. Maybe that’s why people said order a size up? I have a normal/average build and have never had a problem with the calves of any other boots. The buckle on the sides is purely decorative. Overall, these boots are pretty clunky with very small calves. If you have extremely skinny legs, they might work for you. If not, don’t buy these 😊
customer_reviews.author: Sav_S

customer_reviews.title: Wow, An Actual Rain Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I finally have rain boots I can actually wear in the rain! It seemed too much to ask with several other pairs I have purchased over the years. We're talking leakage, people. Dampness. Sogginess. While I haven't yet worn these during a serious storm, I have worn them after strong storms as I've negotiated a flooded front or backyard. Shazam, my feet stayed dry. It's awesome. Thank you, Kamik.
customer_reviews.author: SSG

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you have abnormally skinny legs
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 8 but sized up to a 9 per the other reviews. While the length was adaquete the calf width is way too small on this boot. I’ve never considered myself as having larger than normal calves but I can barely get my legs into these boots. They are extremely painful to wear. I thought the tops of these boots would widen after wearing them for several times but they haven’t. I even bought liners to see if they would make the boot shafts less painful but no luck. I wish I could still return them as I basically cannot use them at all.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCat843

customer_reviews.title: Tight calf, narrow shoe. ORDER UP!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality boot. Insole seems comfortable and soft. Narrow (felt like a suction cup putting it on) and tight calf. I am 5’10’, 195 pounds and am beginning to notice my calves are wider than they used to be, but I’m not a lifetime wide calf gal. I was afraid i wouldn’t be able to get these off. Sad. They seemed to be well-constructed!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: In Love With Berry!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Berry color. I am very pleased with it. I would call it a plumy pink. It's beautiful. Still classy looking, but oh so fun. I am normally a 7 and 1/2. I ordered an 8. They fit well. A little loose in the foot, which I would expect since they don't have my usual half size. I put them on with a pair of skinny jeans that don't fit ultra tight and they fit great. They are super comfortable. I decided to buy this style because I'm 5 foot 2 and other reviews commented that some other styles looked less than flattering on us short folks. I'm happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: My favorite rainboots!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite little rainboots. The look really nice and fit me although I am a 5.5. I love the matte finish that these have, and I greatly enjoy rainy days now knowing I will get to use these boots. I once got caught in a huge storm here and people told me they were jealous of my rainboots. However, these boots don't have much give (which is obvious as they're all rubber) at the ankle so driving with them is extremely difficult. The buckle I think is also purely decorative and doesn't actually work to tighten the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Sized up and Still no go.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9, purchased a 10 and can’t get my feet into the boot. I managed to jam my slightly small foot in and the calves were tight. I’m not thin, but have never had a problem like this. Of course, my husband recycled the box, so I’ll be giving these to my size 8-81/2 mother in law. Boots are cute but I would assume very hot and they are heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Katey Pooh

customer_reviews.title: If you want a hernia, these boots are for you
customer_reviews.text: I returned these within hours of receiving them. I really wish I would've heeded the advice of other reviews saying how tight the ankle was. Please don't make the same mistake/waste time like I did. These boots may seem durable but they are damn near impossible to get on, even sizing up. I had to have my husband help get them off once I was able to get them on. I think a hernia is en route.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit, great height.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t yet report on the durability but these boots are perfect for a petite person. I am 5”3 and slim and with slightly thick socks or sweat pants on these are too tight. They’d be perfect with tights. They are mostly tight around the top of the foot up to the ankle, but I like the formed look they have. They are just the right height for a shorter person. I read the height on their boots and literally measured my leg to see which would come too close to the back of my knee.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome! I am a true 8.5 and ordered the 9 and they fit nice and snug. They don't scrunch up like a lot of rain boots do. They're sturdy and are tall enough to withstand rain and snow. I gave them 4 stars because I would've liked them to be a little taller because they hit right above the calf and are a little snug. They're spacious enough to wear boot socks but they're still just slightly too snug for my taste. They're also not slip-proof and I have to be very careful if there's ice. Other than that, I love them and wear them all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pleased!
customer_reviews.text: My old rain boots started to leak after 5 years and I looked at SEVERAL potential replacement rain boots on Amazon before pulling the trigger. I listened to the reviews and bought 1 size bigger than I normally wear. They fit great, look great, and I was pleased with the size, especially because my feet can sometimes run a bit wide. So far, I haven't noticed any issues with the sole-liner coming out when I pull my feet out (something that happened with my last rain boots). Great boots, great price!!
customer_reviews.author: steven r.

customer_reviews.title: my favorite winter boots
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite rain boots to wear when the weather gets cooler because it is really warm and durable. My first pair lasted 5 years; my last pair got some weird cracks after a year, but I still think that's pretty good given that I wore them almost every day for half a year. Super comfortable to walk in. I think it runs a little small, so I order a size up.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Adorable Boots!
customer_reviews.text: These things are so cute! FYI, I read that they run small, so I tried them on at a store and they DO run about a half-size small. I wear a size 6-1/2, so I ordered a size 7. Also, please note that they are really snug. If you have wide feet , large ankles, or large calves, they aren't going to fit. But as far as stylish and flattering, I give them a big thumbs-up! Also, finally a nice boot made in Canada....not China. No chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: salesgirl555

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Run small
customer_reviews.text: My shoe size is 6-6.5, but I always get 7 in boots. This one fits my feet well but the calf area barely fits my small calf. I probably could use a 7.5 or 8. Anyone with average to bigger calves will not be able to fit in these. I got the Black not the Black original. Not sure of this makes any difference.
customer_reviews.author: THAIGER

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot, Runs Small
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and ordered up in size, I am a 7.5 and I ordered an 8. They fit with a regular pair of socks, but if you plan on wearing heavy socks I would order even with more wiggle room. Style is great! I consider myself to have "regular" size calves, but I did see a lot of questions around this as I shopped - I did notice that they fit me, but again, not a lot of room for thick jeans, or some extra size to my calves in general, so if you are worried about this being an issue, it probably will be!
customer_reviews.author: D. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: These boots do the trick! I wouldn't wear them in the winter, but I did wear them lobster fishing in Maine and they kept my feet warm out on the water in 50 degree weather. They are also stylish enough I can wear them, to work on rainy days. I will say I could have bought a size bigger, so I could have fit a larger sock in them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great Rain Boots
customer_reviews.text: Fits great! I can squeeze even my boot cut pants in these 15" circumference boots. Great quality. I also tried them with leg warmers and they looked super cute. I wear size 8-8.5 and size 9 is perfect so that I have room to add an extra pair of warm socks for warmth, yet fit looser for a quick run to feed and water chickens without extra socks. Great price. I also tried Bogs and returned because the circumference wasn't as wide and twice the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviewers who said these run small. An 8 fit me with very thin socks on, but there’s no way anything heavier would fit in these boots. Calves are just a little tight as well, which is not a problem I have normally with boots. I’ve ordered a 9 and will update this review when they arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit at the ankle
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn them anyplace, just tried them on. I wear an 8- 8 1/2 for width. In a boot I wear a 9 for extra ease..... I purchased a size 10, thinking they could be slipped on quickly...while running out the door. Wrong--they are very snug at the ankle... I don't have full ankles or calves. The boot is heavier than I expected them to be. The reason I eventually bought them was the 50% price reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly P.

customer_reviews.title: major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots, I was so excited, they are great, I couldn't wait to try them on. I ordered them because the description stated they ran small, I ordered a size 6, I typically wear a 5 and have to resort in buying boots from the little girls dept. The boot is way to tight for my calf, if you are wide in that area don't bother, your skin will hang over. If you order I suggest 1 1/2 sizes larger than you typically wear.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia J

customer_reviews.title: These boots are great quality and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These boots are of great quality and sturdy, and can feel a little stiff if one is not used to them. I got a few pairs in my usual size and they work for me. They do run smaller than some other boots in the same size and may not accommodate thick socks in the shoebox or thicker pants/jeans down the shaft. They are also a little shorter on the shaft length and may not keep out as much rain or puddles. Overall the colors and quality are good and the price is also reasonable. I have gotten lots of compliments on them. They are like the "work horses of rain boots" while still looking pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Ohmydawg

customer_reviews.title: ❤️
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 7 in most shoe brands. A size 9 is a good fit with thick socks on. The shaft is very narrow. These are a very good boot though. I like that they can look cute with a pair of jeans while also keeping you dry. I’ve worn them to play in the snow and when it’s rained and I’ve loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Skinny calves, but wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots, even though many of the reviews say the calf is too skinny. I have extremely skinny legs (think chicken legs) and figured I would be safe, but that is not completely true. These boots are pretty tight, when wearing thin leggings, I have to push them down and situate them before being able to walk out of the house. However, the boots are wonderful besides that. I have no issues walking long distances in these, and have walked around outlet malls for hours with these on, without my feet hurting. Thus, I will take the extra few minutes to push my jeans or leggings into them, for the wonderful comfort they provide.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy boots
customer_reviews.text: These fit fine, but they rub the back of my heels which is very uncomfortable. Maybe they'll stop doing that once they're broken in. I don't know if rubber boots work that way. Anyway, I have nothing to compare them to, but other than the rubbing they do the job I intended and they seem like sturdy boots.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hesse

customer_reviews.title: Great price decent boot!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! I was not sure how these would fit I’m normally between 7-8 so reading reviews I went with the size 8, they are a little snug. I did order the boot linings, which are great. You can’t wear too thick of a sock so if you want some extra room I would go up a little. An 8.5 would be perfect.. But I’m happy with them and would recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: But they are warm and waterproof and adorable and perfect for my 20 minute walk to work ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a slightly larger size so i could layer with socks... Not necessary! These boots are so warm I wear them in Chicago all winter without any additional socks. Just normal nylons underneath, or regular socks. The boots are a very thick rubber material so they don't breathe (obviously) and keep in all the warmth... but also all the sweat eventually, so I typically don't wear them for longer than an hour. But they are warm and waterproof and adorable and perfect for my 20 minute walk to work or a walk to the grocery shopping and I don't have to wear extra socks.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Way too small for anyone with a normal sized calves
customer_reviews.text: Way too small for anyone with a normal sized calf. I am a size 8.5 shoe, size 10 body and I could not get a size 9 boot on. So I re-ordered a size 10 boot thinking they would have plenty of room, but nope, way too tight to comfortably wear for any amount of time. Sad since they are super cute.
customer_reviews.author: Rae R.

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: This boot is made with great quality and I love mine. However, I wear a size 8 but saw many reviews saying they ran small so I ordered a size 9 pair. The size 9 was still a bit small and definitely way too snug on my calves. So I exchanged it to a size 11 because I thought one size up wouldn't be enough for the calf area to be comfortable. The size 11 foot part is quite bit on me now but the calves for a lot better. Even though the foot part is quite big, I decided to keep my pair because everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: igraine

customer_reviews.title: Order at least a full size up.
customer_reviews.text: I had to exchange these as they were very difficult to put on and very tight in the bridge. I ended up going with a different style. I am tall, and as some reviewers have stated, these are better for shorter legs. I did like that they were slim in the calf. I ordered these to replace my 4-yr-old Western Chiefs that finally sprung a leak. Those are a 9 but my usual boot size is 10. I ordered a 10 in these and would have definitely needed an 11 for them to fit.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Hansford

customer_reviews.title: Water Tight! But small
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7.5, I ordered an 8. Merchant was great and exchanged it for a size 10. The 10 is a little tight but workable. They are tight on the calf and create quite a suction when you try to take them off. That said, they will serve me well and are Water Tight!! Comfortable foot inside, the sole is tough and thick. I may order these next time i need a new pair but will order an 11.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, run VERY small.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality boots but the fit is SUPER small. I wear an 8.5, which would be a 9 as these only come in whole sizes, and had ordered a 10 wanting extra room- it JUST fit. I didn't rate the product as being too small as it does fit me, but these are NOT boots for people with large feet- my feet are fairly slender and the 10 fit my 8.5 foot exactly, which makes me think the 11- the largest size- would only fit about a 9. Other than that I am super pleased with the quality, and the traction on the soles is great- just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Erin C

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!!!
customer_reviews.text: I literally wear these rain bots ALL THE TIME. Rain or shine or snow or hail. I find them really comfortable and convenient. I can just slip my feet right in and don't even need to bend down to pull them on. My only complaint is that the side buckle always comes off. Eventually I ended up just cutting it off because it was bugging me. These are fully waterproof and considering I have worn them every single day for a year, they have not shown any signs of wear and tear yet. I have really skinny legs so the top doesn't cup my calves but I don't mind the extra space at all.
customer_reviews.author: Leela13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rain boots
customer_reviews.text: Perfect rain boots! I usually wear 7.5-8 so I got an 8 and they fit great including calf area. I'd say I have a toned calf area, not too skinny nor thick. I am 5'3 135lbs for reference. As for comfort I wore them two days in a row to a festival and they were surprisingly very comfortable even with having to break them in. My feet were only tired by day 2 because of all the walking I did but my feet were not sore or in pain because of the boots. I searched for the perfect fit boot without having to pay a lot and these definitely fit the bill!
customer_reviews.author: jackie fonseca

customer_reviews.title: As far as comfortable, not very
customer_reviews.text: As far as every day wear, they are as advertised. Water proof. As far as comfortable, not very. The foot bed may as well be card board. Had to replace with something better. Other than that, for what I paid for them I'm happy. I'm out every day with my dog, a Border Collie. I need water proof boots for exercising him. Plus yard work, in the garden. We have a pretty good size creek that seperates our back yard from the rest of our property and it can be anywhere from a couple inches to a foot deep in spots. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SueBev

customer_reviews.title: Love it but too small
customer_reviews.text: I took everyone's advise and ordered a size up; I normally wear a 9 and ordered a 10. However, the ankle part is still a bit difficult to fit in especially if you are wearing thick socks. And even though the calf fit, it would be too tight if you try to stuff your jeans in it. I love the boot but have to return it since it's too small for me, but I would definitely recommend to people who can fit in it. It is a quality rain boot and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CiCi

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I was skeptical since there are a few negative reviews on how they fit but I am loving them. I normally wear a 7.5 so I wasn't sure if going to an 8 would be enough. But it was! I even have wide feet and have no problem getting them on. They have been great for winter so far and I am hoping to order them in other colors too. I would say go up a size or half size but other than that, I am very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklie33

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these boots
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these boots! I needed some taller boots for fishing, and some that my pants would fit down in. I have big calves, so the pant fit is a little tight. The boots are adjustable, but its not a huge adjustment. I wear a 7, and ordered an 8, and they fit perfectly. The colors are cute. Very durable but comfortable boot! Not too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, but they run so small. I’m a 6.5, so ordered 7, but now I’m going for the 8. I like that Kamik will recycle the boots when they wear out, and have had great experience with their customer service in the past.
customer_reviews.author: S. Massaro

customer_reviews.title: Trust the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I should have trusted the reviews saying these boots run small. I'm usually a 9-9.5 and based on the size chart, went with a 9. Should have listened to the reviews and ordered up! They were good quality boots and the insoles felt nice and squishy (when I reached in with my hand, unfortunately I couldn't get my foot past the narrow ankles).
customer_reviews.author: Emily Berglund

customer_reviews.title: Too tight on calves
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews that said these boots were too narrow in the calf, I went ahead and bought them anyway. Well, they ended up being too tight. I wouldn't be able to wear anything thicker than leggings with them. I'd say I have average size calves. And the buckle on one of the boots was broken when I got them. I would not recommend them to anyone, unless you have tiny legs. I ended up buying sperry pelican rainboots and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Love rainy days now!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so darn cute! Love wearing them. Feel safe that I’m not going to slip running around in the rain carrying kids. The navy with pink sole is true color to image posted. I will say this though, I’m quite short and weigh about 120lbs the boots fit my calves fine and would be ok with leggings in winter - however if I gained 5lbs I feel like the boot shaft would start to be tight around my calves. Hope that helps!
customer_reviews.author: Hollandaze

customer_reviews.title: Runs small and tight- so uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a problem with one shoe or boot fitting differently between my feet. But these boots (size 6) seem to be very inconsistent in sizing between them. The left foot boot fits fine. The right foot boot is so tight and uncomfortable- I never have foot pain but the right boot hurts my foot so badly! Wish I could rerun them. But alas, they were a Christmas present that I didn’t need to use until the muddy spring weather arrived. Now the mud is here and I have a painful right foot from these terrible fitting boots. Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Marie Pierc

customer_reviews.title: Hold up great no matter the use
customer_reviews.text: I actually use these as muck boots and rain boots, depending on the time of year for my job. I size up in these so I can make sure they’re quick to slip on and fit jeans inside. They hold up great, are very comfortable, I even wore them as my only pair of shoes on a trip for 3 weeks straight - walking every day. My second pair of the same shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Foot size is perfect - calf size does not correlate.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because they are really, really cute. Unfortunately, while the foot size is perfect, the company did not correlate that to the calf size and therefore they are not going to fit anyone except skinny minis or shorter women who may have bigger feet. I'm going to step up my legwork at the gym and see if that will help.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: I recommend ordering a size larger and like the calf size
customer_reviews.text: I just took out the boot to wear and the right side of the buckle strap is loose and appears to be ready to slip off/out of the buckle. I am hoping the company will be able to an exchange or replacement for this purchase. Do NOTE: I had a prior boot from Kamik and loved the product. It is waterproof. I bought the size 8 in this style based on reviews because a size 7 probably would have been too short and narrow for my foot. This size for me was perfect in the toe box and length, but does not have very much arch support. I am giving 4-star because of the loose strap/buckle.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look great, but getting them on was extremely difficult
customer_reviews.text: The issue was not whether the boot fit my shoe size, but I found it almost impossible to get my heel into the boot. It took me quite a while. Once my feet were in them, they felt great. There is no give in the material. Sadly, I have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Munno

customer_reviews.title: Runs small/narrow
customer_reviews.text: These boots look great and I was so upset that I couldn't wear them. I am a 9.5/10 and don't ever need to order a wide, and generally have no issues with shoe sizing, so I thought a 10 would fit well. I couldn't even get my foot into the shoe at all. My toes wouldn't even clear the arch area. So bummed! These boots look fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Size Up
customer_reviews.text: These are super cute and great quality. I would size up though. I’m a size 9 so I got the 9 and there is no way I can wear socks with these. They are tight. Might give them to my daughter and get another pair in 10’s.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jecklin

customer_reviews.title: great quality but doesnt fit for a short person 5-3"
customer_reviews.text: great quality but I'm only 5-3" and the boot height is too tall for me. It hits my knee and constrains walking properly. The shorter version works perfect otherwise I would have kept the boots. great buy for a low price! high quality material and well made. If you are tall you can walk easily.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great quality budget boot, run small
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for about a month. They're very high quality for the price. They have a heavy, thick sole and good traction. That being said, they run small. I typically wear an 8 1/2 shoe; my previous rainboots were an 8. I ordered a size 9 based on others' comments that they run small - this is very much true. Even at a 9, they just fit. I don't think I'd be able to wear very thick socks with these boots. They are also very tight around the calf, making them a bit difficult to take off.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Tight in calf
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed that I have to send these back. They are much too tight in the calf area, it was very hard to get them on. I have lots of tall boots, and I usually don't have a problem with the calf being too tight. I usually wear a 7 or 7.5 shoe, and I ordered a size 8. They seem like really nice quality boots and are super cute, but unfortunately are much too tight around the calf.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle & Christine

customer_reviews.title: Rainy Day Savers
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! Arrived on time. I routinely where a women's 9.5, I ordered a 10M. Opened the box and tried them on with mid weight wool socks. I was able to tuck my skinny jeans in them with no issue. There is room that I should also be able to wear a heaver wool sock as well. I do have a average foot and calf widths. The result? Perfect rainy day boots for walking the dog, or dogs in my case! I volunteer at the local SPCA walking shelter dogs two days a week, so these are exactly what the doctor ordered. The insole and heel configuration make for a comfortable walking boot. Nothing sloppy about these rain boots.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Yes, too small!!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these root is very good. I read the reviews and a lot of people said it runs small. I usually wear 6.5, so I ordered a 7, but they were still too small for me. I am 5'2'' and 120lbs and these boots are too tall (almost up to my knees) and also very narrow for my calves. I am going to return them and exchange for the Jenny Angle rain boots (shorter), and this time I order 8 (bigger), and hope that they will work out this time. I am the same brand name again because the quality is very good, not the cheaply made rain boots at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ykeru

customer_reviews.title: Great rain boots
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot I would have gotten it a half size larger, it’s a little hard to pull off. I really appreciate the fact that once the boot becomes old or is worn down for disposal that they want to recycle (Wouldn’t mind if the boots are sent back).
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I wear between an 8 1/2 or 9, and ordered the 9. I'm wear a dress size of 10, so I'm no stick figure, but I do not have large or muscular calves. If you do, these may not be the boots for you. I wear these for gardening and out when it's rainy. They do not leak at all and have shown zero signs of wear. I got the magenta-purple ones and they are adorable. I get tons of compliments! Even my fashion conscious tween tries to steal them. They are not shiny/glossy which I like!
customer_reviews.author: KyKy

customer_reviews.title: She loved the color
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the rain boots for my mom in Puerto Rico for her to do some gardening. She loved the color. She wears a size 5 but does have wide feet so I purchased a size 6 and it was a little snug so she couldn't wear thick cotton socks only with nylon, but she is still wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but hard to remove.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for about a year and a half. They've held up very well and are really comfortable. These do run small! Once I've got them on they're super comfortable (wore them all day at our state fair) but I usually need my husband's help to get them off. It's almost like they suction on my feet. I'm thinking of getting the size 7 but I'm afraid of them being sloppy feeling when I walk. I'm typically a size 5.5 in woman's shoes and thouh the size would work.
customer_reviews.author: N Oldsmoboche

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, but I like them
customer_reviews.text: The ankle of these boots were small enough that I had to return the first pair and order a size up - I couldn't get my foot into them because of how small the ankle part was. However, the size up pair are wonderful!. Sturdy, holding up well, comfortable, waterproof. I use them for snow but mostly for mucking around the yard and chicken coop. My daughter also bought a pair after seeing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schenck

customer_reviews.title: Order 1 or 2 sizes UP!!!
customer_reviews.text: They are lovely... just order a size or two up! I normally wear a 9.5 and ordered a 10. Wayyy too small. I should have gone with an 11. No biggie because I'll just give them to my sister as a late christmas gift. :)
customer_reviews.author: D-Rock

customer_reviews.title: Don't order unless your calves are 14" or smaller
customer_reviews.text: I had read "don't order unless your calves are 14" or smaller" in another review, but I have fairly skinny legs so I assumed they'd be fine. These seemed nice when they arrived, but way too tight on the calves....so I measured mine; 15". I should have measured before ordering!!! If you have small calves, these would be nice. I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Too tight, even when ordering the proper length
customer_reviews.text: While I like the look of this boot, I was not pleased with the sizing. I read the reviews and knew they ran small. However, wearing a 7.5, I thought an 8 would work fine. It did in length; but, there was so much pressure on the top of my feet, they are not at all comfortable. They are simply too tight. Also, my heel pulls up at every step.
customer_reviews.author: lgarde00

customer_reviews.title: The shoe box is too small.
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of the shoes. The price is reasonable. It is light charcoal with coral instead of with pink/ red. (It is written Charcoal Red on the box.) The problem is the shoe box is really too small for these shoes. I have just taken the shoes out from the box after receiving them. One of them is bent.
customer_reviews.author: Millie Light

customer_reviews.title: I love the design
customer_reviews.text: I love the design. I am skinny. I wear size 6 and I ordered size 7. But It needs to be 2 size up if you wear socks. Specially, ankle area is too narrow, so it's hard to take off my boots. The material is too stiff and makes my top of foot is sore. So.. I ordered Crocs brand boots with 7size because I do not want to return Kamick. Crocs is bigger than Kamick even same size. Anyway, I wear Kamick boots for few months with bare foot. The Stiff material turns to be softer. It is fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They're perfect. These are narrow in the shaft of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally wanted a pair of Hunters but couldn't bring myself to spend all the money on a pair. I ended up coming across these for a fraction of the price and decided to give them a try. They're perfect. These are narrow in the shaft of the boot, but I have narrow calves (not very muscular and defined) and these fit me perfectly. I can imagine that someone with a more muscular leg could have difficulty wearing boot socks or skinny jeans with these. I also normally wear a 7.5 but based off of other reviews, I ordered an 8 and they fit percectly.
customer_reviews.author: kristin o

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Sleek, and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: This brand runs small. I am a 7 so I ordered an 8 and they fit perfectly. I have bought Kamik in the past for my kids and the quality is great! This style is a little sleeker then others in their line. These are a lightweight rainboot, I use them in spring/fall weather for wading and rainy days. They likely would not keep my feet super warm in snow like Bogs but they are way more comfortable and less bulky to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Griesel

customer_reviews.title: Very Cute ~ Well Made ~ But do run very small~!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in a size 8 but couldn't get my foot in, so I exchanged them for a size 10 and these fit GREAT. I am a true size 8 in every shoe I've ever worn so I was really surprised at the fit of the 8's when they arrived...I'm so Happy I went up to a 10 vs a 9. I don't think 9 would have left room for socks or liners. They are super cute and feel like they are very well made~ Don't hesitate to get them a couple of sizes bigger than your regular size though....they do run very small~!!
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: GREAT barn boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! Yes, they do run small... I usually wear a 7.5 or 8 and got the 9 in them. 9 fits perfectly on me; I am about 140lbs and 5'4 with medium calves. The calf area is snug but I still have about an inch space, so it doesn't bother me. Got these boots to wear at the barn around horses and mucking stalls, bathing, etc and they have been wonderful; very well made and waterproof and seem like they will last a long time. Spend the few extra dollars on these rather than the cute-sie design ones that only last a few months!
customer_reviews.author: Cale Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional dog groomer and bought these to use in the salon when washing large dogs. These are absolutely wonderful and I end up wearing them all day! They are comfortable, durable, and look great! I wear a size 7-7.5 and ordered a 7 because previous boots I’ve purchased (other brands) tended to be larger than expected. This boot is a true 7 so if you plan on wearing thick socks, I would recommend ordering a size up. Overall, I’m very happy with this purchase and would definitely order again!
customer_reviews.author: Toni J.

customer_reviews.title: Order half a size up
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I genuinely purchased these for gardening boots. That said, I’m in love with them! They are so awesome! Exactly as pictured and comfy! I’m a true 7.5 and sized up to 8. They fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these boots for about a week now, but I love them! I read through the reviews before making my purchase. A lot of reviewers posted about them being on the small side. I went 1/2 size larger and they fit great! I have average size legs and am able to wear these boots with leggings or skinny jeans no problem. Kamik boots have styles made in USA and Canada. These are made in Canada. It's such a nice change from seeing Made in China!
customer_reviews.author: Landry

customer_reviews.title: If you wear heavy socks, order up a size
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Kamik Rain Boots. I live on an island and use my boots for beach walking when it's too cold for barefeet or if I don't want to get sand between my toes. I usually wear a 39 (8.5 US) The size 9 fit with a pair of socks. If my socks were hiking socks, I would order up one size.
customer_reviews.author: VDay

customer_reviews.title: They are roomy at the ankle and pretty tight at the top
customer_reviews.text: No nasty plastic smell! I could wear them all day the first time I wore them. I order a size up from my usual size to make room for fleece bootliners. The fleece bootliners made this practically luxurious. Without the liners, my feet feel cold, so I think they are a must. They are roomy at the ankle and pretty tight at the top. I am 5'7 and 160 lbs but I have bigger calves and tucking jeans into these boots would be a pain. If you have big calves like me, you might want to consider something else! Hope this helps. Top quality shoe, but the fit is a little funny.
customer_reviews.author: Anne from Cali

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! They are super comfortable, and seem like they will hold up well. My only problem is that (like other reviewers said) the leg of the boot is very narrow. I did as others suggested and sized up-- I normally wear 7.5 and I bought a 9. The foot of the boot fits well, but the leg is still TIGHT! I bought these for an upcoming camp out where rain is expected, so I will keep them. I'm hoping with a little wear they will stretch a bit. Other than that I love them! True to color and very well made!
customer_reviews.author: BJ2009

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these rain boots! They seem thick enough to last a while and they look great. My only complaint is that they are slightly narrow when slipping them on. I can only wear thin socks or my feet will not get past the ankle area into the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Angie12345678

customer_reviews.title: Really stiff in the ankle
customer_reviews.text: They're super tight around the ankle, so I'm sore after wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: If you have narrow feet and small calves.
customer_reviews.text: Yes the calf is small and these are narrow but those are the two things I absolutely love about these boots! I have super narrow feet and I hate clunky rain boots. These fit me like a glove, they have great arch support and I'm so happy I purchased them. By the way the berry is a deeper pink than the picture looks, but it's nice. They have awesome grip and flexibility too which I love. So if you have narrow feet and small calves and hate clunky regular rain boots buy these, you'll be happy you did!
customer_reviews.author: GKDK

customer_reviews.title: Tight!
customer_reviews.text: This boot is a decent boot, however it is extremely narrow in the ankle. I purchased this for my grand daughter. She wears a 10 which is what I ordered first, then 11. Both were tight in the ankle. Then I switched brands and got her the Hunter boot in an 11, worked beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: mrod

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots! I've owned Kamik rain boots in the past, and the quality is just as I remember it. Taking into account the reviews, I ordered a size up, and I would say they're true to size. I typically wear a 6 or 6 1/2, so I ordered a 7 and even with a pair of socks and boot liners, I still have plenty of room. They are a tad narrow through the ankles, so if you have large calves, these aren't the boots for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Beaver

customer_reviews.title: From typical rain boot to rugged work boot - A++!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots since 2014, and they are my most trusted pair of footwear! I originally bought these for when I was walking around on campus during rainy days. They have since been with me through several jobs which involve a lot of walking and a lot of water. They even lived through hiking around the Sierra Nevada foothills during the rains of 2017 and still keep my feet dry in wet field work. I never intended them to last this long or survive such abuse (and they don't look new, that's for sure) but they will be with me until they get holes - whenever that may be! Probably the best purchase I've made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Everett

customer_reviews.title: Not good for women with wide calves
customer_reviews.text: If you have larger calves, and normally buy “wide calf boots” these boots are not for you. I have wide calves and couldn’t get them to go up past my ankles/mid calf- for some reason, I was able to get the boot all the way up on my right leg, but it was literally cutting off my circulation. These are great and cute for women with skinny calves, but not us gals with thicker, more muscular calves- which is a big part of the female population btw (hint hint boot maker industry)
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: I'm so impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm first going to say this product arrived on time and shipping wasn't expensive. Secondly I saved a lot of money buying these boots here instead of in the store. They fit absolutely perfect. They fit tighter around the calf area (which I like) I usually wear around a size 7.5 and I ordered an 8 and it was perfect. I also ordered to boot socks as well and they feel awesome! I was looking for more of a fashion rain boot and I definitely got it without spending an arm & a leg. I'm so excited to wear these! I'm definitely impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for small calves
customer_reviews.text: Love these rain boots :) they fit perfectly and do their job. I have tiny calves so it was such a struggle to find boots that I wouldn’t look ridiculous in. I still have space to wear leg warmers if I want. I would definitely recommend these boots, especially to those who also have small calves like i do.
customer_reviews.author: GTS

customer_reviews.title: Well made but narrow
customer_reviews.text: This style was too hard for me to take on and off, but I'm impressed with the quality and looking at their muck boots instead. Would be good for small calved women as a city winter boot. Your feet get HOT in these
customer_reviews.author: Erin

product_meta.title: Kamik Women's Olivia Rain Boot
product_meta.description:
Chic-up your rainy day look with this fashionable yet practical rubber boot from Kamik. Featuring a wide shaft for easy pull-on dressing, the Olivia is softly lined and roomy enough for a thick pair of socks on those extra chilly days. Team it with a classic trench coat and cute umbrella, and you'll find yourself looking forward to stormy weather!

Kamik comes from a place of extremes. Where the harshest conditions intersect with some of the most beautiful sights you'll ever see. At Kamik, we make footwear that brings to life our northern origins. Singular. Strong. Simply dependable. We've been doing it for over 100 years. Day after day. 24/7. The result of all this effort: a complete line of outdoor footwear built to deliver superior comfort and reliable protection in the most extreme conditions. We know you wouldn't have it any other way. Insole-Comfort insole with breathable mesh
feature_bullets: Rubber rainboot featuring decorative side buckle and removable comfort footbed
